## Entrada de dados no R

## Carregando dados


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(qcc)
library(tidyverse)
data(pistonrings)
```
:::


## Explorando os dados


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(pistonrings)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>   diameter sample trial
#> 1   74.030      1  TRUE
#> 2   74.002      1  TRUE
#> 3   74.019      1  TRUE
#> 4   73.992      1  TRUE
#> 5   74.008      1  TRUE
#> 6   73.995      2  TRUE
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(pistonrings)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>     diameter         sample        trial        
#>  Min.   :73.97   Min.   : 1.00   Mode :logical  
#>  1st Qu.:74.00   1st Qu.:10.75   FALSE:75       
#>  Median :74.00   Median :20.50   TRUE :125      
#>  Mean   :74.00   Mean   :20.50                  
#>  3rd Qu.:74.01   3rd Qu.:30.25                  
#>  Max.   :74.04   Max.   :40.00
```


:::
:::


## Manipulando os dados


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
aneisdepistao <- pistonrings %>% 
  rename(diametro = diameter, amostra = sample, fase1 = trial)
aneisdepistao <- as_tibble(aneisdepistao)
```
:::


## Gráfico de Contre da Média e Amplitude

## Regras

Um vetor de valores que especifica as regras usadas para declarar um processo fora de controle. Os valores possíveis são:

1.  Gráficos de um ponto fora dos limites de controle 3-sigma.

2.  Dois dos três pontos consecutivos são plotados além de um limite de 2 sigma.

3.  Quatro dos cinco pontos consecutivos vão além do limite de 1 sigma.

4.  Oito pontos consecutivos plotados em um lado da linha central.

Estas são frequentemente conhecidas como regras da Western Electric.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
diametro <- qccGroups(data = aneisdepistao, diametro, amostra)

(graf1 <- qcc(diametro[1:25,], type="xbar", rules = 1:4))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> ── Quality Control Chart ───────────────────────── 
#> 
#> Chart type                 = xbar 
#> Data (phase I)             = diametro[1:25, ] 
#> Number of groups           = 25 
#> Group sample size          = 5 
#> Center of group statistics = 74.00118 
#> Standard deviation         = 0.009785039 
#> 
#> Control limits at nsigmas  = 3 
#>       LCL     UCL
#>  73.98805 74.0143
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(graf1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=90%}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
(graf2 <- qcc(diametro[1:25,], type="R", rules = 1:4))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> ── Quality Control Chart ───────────────────────── 
#> 
#> Chart type                 = R 
#> Data (phase I)             = diametro[1:25, ] 
#> Number of groups           = 25 
#> Group sample size          = 5 
#> Center of group statistics = 0.02276 
#> Standard deviation         = 0.009785039 
#> 
#> Control limits at nsigmas  = 3 
#>  LCL        UCL
#>    0 0.04812533
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(graf2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-2.png){width=90%}
:::
:::
